name: Kristen Shinohara
bio: Kristen was a PhD student advised by Jake Wobbrock and Wanda Pratt. She worked with Andy multiple times as a teaching assistant, and later on nationwide survey of higher education instruction on accessibility. She graduated in 2017 and joined the faculty at Rochester Institute of Technology.

name: Annie Yan
bio: Annie is a Ph.D. student in the Information School working with Carol Palmer. Annie worked with Andy on predicting dropout in a coding tutorial.

name: Ada Kim
bio: Ada is a Ph.D. student in the Information School working with Katie Davis. Ada worked with Andy on a pedagogical analysis of coding tutorials as part of a research practicum.

name: Saba Kawas
bio: Saba is a PhD student in the Information School working with Katie Davis. Saba worked with Andy on a nationwide survey of the teaching of accessibility in higher education in the United States.

name: Benjamin Xie
bio: Benji is a PhD student in the Information School interested in learning analytics for computing education. Before joining UW, he studied App Inventor and MOOCs with Hal Abelson at MIT.

name: Greg Nelson
bio: Greg is a PhD student in Computer Science and Engineering. He's interested in HCI and computing education broadly, and has focused on programming language learning and augmented and virtual reality.

name: Kyle Thayer
bio: Kyle is a PhD student in Computer Science and Engineering, also advised by Katharina Reinecke. He studies the intersection of diversity and learning in computing education.

name: Amanda Swearngin
bio: Amanda is a Ph.D. student in Computer Science & Engineeering and is interested in Software Engineering, HCI, and making software easier to learn, use, and make. She is investigating a range of techniques for reverse engineering useful models of user interfaces.

name: Dastyni Loksa
bio: Dastyni is a Ph.D. student in the the Information School. His research focuses on problem solving in programming, with a particular focus on self-regulated learning, spanning the fields of HCI and computing education. Dastyni completed his bachelors in Informatics at the University of California, Irvine.

name: Zakariya Dehlawi
bio: Zak is a Ph.D. student in the the Information School, co-advised by Andrew Ko and Barbara Endicott-Popovsky. He received his Master of Science in Security Informatics from Johns Hopkins in 2011 and bachelor degrees in Computer Engineering and Political Science from the University of Washington in 2009. His research focuses on security practices in software teams and organizations and he serves as a Senior Security Engineer at Security Innovation, Inc.

name: Paul Luo Li
bio: Paul Luo Li, now a Senior Data Scientist at Microsoft, was a Ph.D. student in the Information School at the University of Washington, advised by Andrew Ko. His research area is Software Engineering Processes. His research interests include user experiences in software engineering activities. He has publications on reliability engineering and metrics in conferences like ICSE and ISSRE. He has a Masters in Software Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University, and a B.S. in Statistics with a minor in Computer Science from the University of Virginia.

name: Michael J. Lee
bio: Michael Lee, now faculty at New Jersey Institute of Technology, was a PhD student in the Information School at the University of Washington, advised by Andrew Ko. His research interests include the social aspects of software development and maintenance, and computer programming education. He has published articles for multi-modal programming environments for children, receiving a best paper award at the ACM Conference on Creativity & Cognition (C&C). He received his Masters degree in 2007 from the School of Information at UC Berkeley, advised by Kimiko Ryokai and Robert Glushko. He received his Bachelors of Science with Distinction in 2005 from the Cognitive Science Department at UC San Diego, advised by David Kirsh and Edwin Hutchins. He is now an Assistant Professor at the New Jersey Institute of Technology in Information Systems.

name: Brian Burg
bio: Brian Burg, now a Senior Software Engineer at Apple, was a Ph.D. student in the CSE Department at the University of Washington, advised by Andrew Ko. His research areas include improving developer productivity, quantifying and furthering application and runtime performance, and understanding languages and software at scale. Brian received his Bachelor of Science with Honors in Computer Science from Purdue University. He is now a Senior Software Engineer at Apple.

name: Parmit K. Chilana
bio: Parmit K. Chilana, now faculty at Simon Fraser University, was a PhD student at the Information School. Her research interests span different aspects of software development, usability, and software support. In recent projects, she has looked at how users express unwanted software behaviors and how support professionals and developers diagnose and respond to user-reported software issues in open source and commercial software development contexts. She is currently exploring the design of contextual-help tools for web applications which leverage crowdsourced solutions from users. Parmit has also collaborated on various projects within UW Medicine and biomedical and health informatics related to improving design of software used for scientific research. Parmit received her MS in Library and Information Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and BSc in Computing Science from Simon Fraser University, Canada. She was a recipient of Canada's SSHRC doctoral fellowship in 2009 and a Facebook PhD fellowship in 2010.

name: Roshanak Zilouichian
bio: Roshanak was a postdoc in the lab working on collaboration, consensus, information visualization, and creativity support tools. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and investigated social aspects of online coding tutorials while at UW. She is now a Data Scientist at Microsoft.

name: Harrison Kwik
bio: Harrison is an undergraduate in computer science interested in equitable learning of computing. He's been supporting the lab's research on programming tutors while independently investigating the experiences of CS transfer students.

name: Leanne Hwa
bio: Leanne is an Informatics undergraduate in computing education, mentorship, and identity. She's supported the lab's research on programming tutors while independently investigating the role of informal computing mentors amongst south Seattle teens.

name: Alex Tan
bio: Alex is an Informatics undergraduate in computing education. He's supported the lab's research on programming tutors.

name: Michael Beswetherick
bio: Michael helped engineer Gidget while an Informatics undergrad. He now helps engineer NY Times.

name: Andre Stackhouse
bio: Andre helped engineer Gidget while an Informatics undergrad, then at Code.org. He now helps engineer Bing at Microsoft.

name: Polina Charters
bio: Polina was a Psychology student who helped develop many of the instruments for our studies of Gidget, and also ran a study evaluating attitude shifts among adults who played Gidget. She went on to our Masters in HCI+Design.

name: Fanny Luor
bio: Fanny was a Design student who illustrated all of the art for Gidget. She went on to design and illustrate at Airbnb and Dropbox.

name: Nadav Ashkenazi
bio: Nadav was a Computer Science and Informatics student who helped engineer Gidget. He went on to Google to help build Earth VR.

name: Staffan Hellman
bio: Staffan was an Informatics student who helped engineer Gidget. He went on to work at Weebly.

name: Steven Raden
bio: Steven was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer Gidget. He went on to work at IBM as a UX designer.

name: William Menten-Weil
bio: Liam was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer our work on programming problem solving tutors, focusing specifically on an advanced tutorial authoring interface.

name: Datoka Miller
bio: Dakota was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer our work on programming problem solving tutors, focusing specifically on an advanced tutorial authoring interface.

name: Alexandra Rowell
bio: Alex was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer our work on programming problem solving tutors, focusing specifically on how to present expert identity.

name: Xing Zhang
bio: Xing was an Electrical Engineering student that helped evaluate Feedlack, our verification tool for finding missing feedback in interfaces.

name: Stephen Ip
bio: Stephen was an Informatics student who helped with our studies of bug triage.

name: Charlie Tran
bio: Charlie was an Informatics student who helped with our studies of bug triage. He went on to become a program manager at Microsoft.

name: Valentina Ferrari
bio: Valentina was an Informatics student who helped with our studies of bug triage. She went on to become a UX designer at Adobe.

name: Neeraja Duriseti
bio: Neeraja was an Informatics and Applied Math student who helped analyze a corpus of tens of thousands of news articles about software failures.

name: Bryan Dosono
bio: Bryan was an Informatics student who helped analyze a corpus of tens of thousands of news articles about software failures. He went on to do a Ph.D. in Information Science at Syracuse University.

name: Padma Vaithyam
bio: Padma was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer Gidget. She went on to Microsoft as a software engineer.

name: Diana Jiang
bio: Diana was an Informatics student who helped design and engineer Gidget.
